entry.title: Interesting Thingys #15
entry.content:
This week with highlights from JavaScript, HTML5, Ruby, …

GIT

  • Git website has a new design

Ruby

  • Multiple Ruby Version Support on Heroku
  • Five common Rails mistakes - Mike Perham
  • How to get 4x the performance out of Heroku with Unicorn

HTML5

  • Polyfills for the Pragmatist
  • Beyond HTML5: Device API's & PhoneGap with Brian Leroux'
  • BBC News - Coding the future: HTML5 takes the internet by storm

Javascript

  • Better code optimization decisions for V8
  • adobe / brackets - An open source code editor for the web, written in JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
  • Physijs - a physics engine for three.js, check out the demos
  • Cueppoint.JS - A plugin for adding cue-points and subtitles to HTML5 Video
  • New Draft Specification for ES.next (Ecma-262 Edition 6)
  • Proxies and Frozen objects
  • Dynamo JS - kind of irritating

CSS

  • Viewport Sized Typography | CSS-Tricks
  • Making a move with CSS3 animations - Dev.Opera

Linux

  • E4RAT - Improving Startup Times by Physical Block Reallocation

Search

  • SwiftType - Let's you integrate an external search to your website. The demo video looks promising.

Security

  • How To Safely Store A Password

Productivity

  • The Haskell / Snap ecosystem is as productive (or more) than Ruby/Rails.

Videos / Talks

  • Node.js in Context with Jason Hoffman of Joyent
  • JavaScript Primitive Types vs Reference Types

Fun

  • Recursive Drawing

entry.title: Interesting Thingys #14
entry.content:
This week we have tons of links in Ruby, HTML5, ...

GIT

  • gaskit - a git-based issue tracker, written in sinatra .. looks very promising
  • Git as a NoSQL Database

Ruby

  • MRuby: A Lightweight Ruby Implementation by Matz - Matz Talks About mruby and Its Possibilities
  • MobiRuby: A Forthcoming Ruby Toolkit for Building iOS Apps
  • Make the Web Fast(er): One Rails App at a Time
  • Keynote: Progress by David Heinemeier Hansson - more Rails Conf 2012 videos can be found @confreaks
  • Exhibit vs Presenter
  • A vision for Cucumber 2.0
  • Meet six misunderstood Ruby features - IBM devloperWorks
  • Focused Controller: Bringing Real OOP to Rails Controllers
  • RubyMotion - Unlock the power of Ruby for iOS

HTML5

  • The Pointer Lock API
  • Bkom Robot Game: An HTML5 Game Demo
  • db.filesystem.js: Bringing the HTML5 Filesystem API to More Browsers
  • Real-world example of the HTML5 FileSystem API

Javascript

  • Videos from jQuery UK 2012
  • JSConf US 2012 - Daniel Henry Holmes Ingalls Jr.: The Lively Kernel

CSS

  • CSSDeck: A Site That Collects Creative CSS Creations
  • CSS Triangles + Animations = Pie Chart Spinner

Databases

  • LINE Storage: Storing billions of rows in Sharded-Redis and HBase per Month
  • MongoDB - Strategies when hitting disk

Mobile Market

  • can you create the next instagram? - tim ferris about 'how to build an app empire', interesting article!

Scrum

  • water-fall-scrum - the reality of agile

Vim

  • Matcher - This is a standalone library that does the same fuzzy-find matching as Command-T.vim. Can be used with CtrlP.

Uncategorized

  • Better than grep - what could it be better?
  • Want good programmers? Then PAY them
  • GIMP 2.8 (Stable) Finally Available For Download
  • Starting Clojure (mk. 2)
  • EU Court of Justice rules you can't copyright a programming language

Fun

  • lolcommits - takes a screenshot everytime you git commit.
  • favris - play tretis 'in' your favicon (only works in Google Chrome).
  • AudioSpank - AudioSpank is an audio only massively multiplayer online first person shooter.

entry.title: Interesting Thingys #13
entry.content:
This time with some hot topics in HTML5, JavaScript, NodeJS, …

Mobile Development

  • PhoneGap 1.6 released

HTML5

  • BBC And YouWeb Bets On HTML5 Games; Invests Millions In Mobile Game Creation Platform Spaceport.io
  • Making a Speedy HTML5 Game
  • Cool scroll effects for lists
  • Date picker landed in Chrome Canary and Chromium
  • Processing XHR2 file uploads in PHP
  • BeerCamp - Cool demonstration of CSS 3D features - detailed article about the making of

JavaScript

  • CoffeeScript 1.3 released
  • ECMAScript.next: arrow functions and method definitions
  • Qt 5 makes JavaScript a first-class citizen for app development
  • Understanding MVVM – A Guide For JavaScript Developers
  • A Chrome Extension for running CoffeeScript from the Web Inspector
  • device.js - Semantic client-side device detection with Media Queries
  • CreateJS - A suite of Javascript libraries & tools for building rich, interactive experiences with HTML5.

NodeJS

  • Dtrace conf 2012, Dtrace in Node.JS
  • Qt bindings for Node.js

Ruby

  • Adhearsion 2.0: It’s ALIIIIVE!
  • Practicing Ruby Volume 2 is now freely available
  • DDD for Rails Developers. Part 2: Entities and Values

CSS

  • Multi-Device Layout Patterns
  • My thoughts about the latest Image Replacement techniques
  • Vertical centering with flexbox and margin fallback

Database

  • MongoDb Architecture
  • Apache CouchDB 1.2.0 released

Usability

  • Nielsen is wrong on mobile

Webserver

  • Add SPDY support to your Apache server with mod_spdy

Browsers

  • Chrome Developer Tools – monitorEvents

Git

  • Remote Branch - Does your pair programmer maintain order, keeping the mean streets (ie. remote branches) clean?

Books

  • Practical Vim - now available in beta
  • JavaScript Enlightment - free eBook - A book to turn a JavaScript library user into a JavaScript developer

Presentations / Talks / Articles

  • The Mobile Revolution: Cultivating Boundaries of the Unbounded
  • Steve Souders discussing the State of WPO and Velocity

Unix

  • A proof that Unix utility "sed" is Turing complete

Fun

  • Mix.js - A Chrome Experiment: Multitrack mixing and real-time metering with Web Audio
  • Semicolon - An esoteric language made up of only semicolons.

entry.title: Interesting Thingys #12
entry.content:
This week with topics from HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, Git, Vim, and much more.

HTML5

  • JavaScript motion detection
  • Modernizing your HTML5 Canvas games Part 1: hardware scaling & CSS3
  • Combining Easel.js and Box2d in Canvas
  • Modernizing your HTML5 Canvas games Part 1: hardware scaling & CSS3 - David Rousset - Site Home - MSDN Blogs

JavaScript

  • Metor - is a set of new technologies for building top-quality webapps in a fraction of the time, whether you're an expert developer or just getting started. Watch the introduction video.
  • idiomatic.js
  • JavaScript motion detection | Adobe Developer Connection

CSS

  • Responsive CSS3 Slider Without Javascript
  • CSS Sprites Revisited

Browsers

  • Big boost to DOM performance - WebKit's innerHTML is 240% faster

Operating Systems

  • How Computers Boot Up

Git

  • Instantly Beautiful Project Pages - Github

Presentations / Talks / Articles

  • Slides from HTML5 community meetup - presents some next generation CSS stuff: filters, shaders - future, when will thou come?

Tools

  • The noun project

Vim

  • Using Vimdiff With Git
  • Write Faster Code by Adding VIM to Visual Studio

Fun

  • 4D Rubik's Cube

entry.title: Interesting Thingys #11
entry.content:
This week with topics from mobile-development, javascript, HTML5 and quantum-physics ..

Mobile Development

  • Novocaine - high performance audio processing (record, play) for iOS / Mac OS X
  • 'Show Source' Bookmarklet - a 'view source' bookmarklet for the iPhone/iPad.

HTML5

  • Canvas v5 API Gets Path Primitives, Ellipses, Dashed Lines, Hit testing, Text on Path,
  • Color input, the Network Information API and Chromium 20

JavaScript

  • POW - Algorithmic sunburst generator via CSS, canvas and jQuery.
  • Async JavaScript - 'Recipes for Event-Driven Code', looks like an interesting ebook.
  • toolbox.no.de - toolbox for node.js applications. first website if you're looking for node.js plugins/modules/etc
  • shell.js - Unix shell commands for Node.js
  • jake - JavaScript build tool, similar to Make or Rake. Built to work with Node.js.
  • Backbone Paginator
  • Why node.js streams are awesome
  • Lessons learned with CSS Regions and Shadow DOM
  • pep.jquery.js - A lightweight plugin for kinetic-drag on mobile/desktop

CSS

  • Paperfold CSS - fold divs like paper

Database

  • Redis Persistence demystified - everything you need to know about persistence in Redis (and comparison to MySql and SQLite).

Operating Systems

  • Linux on an 8bit micro

OS X

  • OSX for Hackers - lots of useful settings you can enable/disable on the command-line for Mac OS X.

Presentations / Talks / Articles

  • iOS Design - 'a case study', nice presentation about the design-process for an iOS application.
  • 2 Billion Jobs to Disappear by 2030 - interesting article about the future of jobs & industries.

Tools

  • split2flac - a tool to split one big AP/FLAC/WAV file into several FLAC/M4A/MP3/OGG/WAV tracks, with tagging, renaming and cover images.

Physics

  • No ordinary genius - a 95min documentary about Richard Feynman, available on youtube.
  • Einsteins unbemerkte Revolution - german article about 'Verschränkung' (entanglement) & 'Spukhafte Fernwirkung' (action at distance) in qunatum-physics.

Fun

  • Is it a condom or is it an Android?
  • Droste effect in Conway's Game of Life
  • Richard Stallman to launch his own fashion line
